newsitem.title: USA: Tseng Labs sees losses, stock tumbles.
newsitem.headline: Tseng Labs sees losses, stock tumbles.

text.p: Tseng Labs Inc., a maker of graphics accelerators and video products for personal computers, Monday warned of a significant loss in the fourth quarter, sparking a sharp selloff of its stock.
The stock lost $1.875, or about one-third of its value, to $4.125 on Nasdaq at midday.
Tseng, based in Newtown, Pa., said it expects to take a one-time charge of $11 million to $14 million in the fourth quarter.
The company said the losses are related to its decision to focus on its three-dimensional Graphics Roadmap product and phase out its two-dimensional graphics technology, which has a limited market.
Tseng said it expects losses beyond the fourth quarter until the company's new 3D graphics product achieves meaningful sales in the third quarter of 1997, at the earliest.
